cyclone.name: FRANKLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles SSW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north tonight, cross Hispaniola on Wednesday, and then accelerate northeast into the southwestern Atlantic away from the Greater Antilles

weather_observation.watch_coast: Turks and Caicos Islands under Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: Entire Dominican Republic coast and southern Haiti under Tropical Storm Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Hispaniola, eastern Cuba coastal waters, Puerto Rico and nearby islands, Turks and Caicos, southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Outer rainbands could bring brief gusts below tropical-storm force; sustained gale-force winds are unlikely (≤3% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at St. Croix; surge threat confined to Hispaniola.
weather_observation.rainfall: Passing bands may drop 1–3 inches of rain, locally higher but generally below 4 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents in the Atlantic exposures beginning late Wednesday.
